Crime_Name: Judicial Review of Refugee Protection Decision
Legal_Issue: Denial of natural justice regarding internal flight alternative (IFA)
Application_Facts: Board indicated delay was the only concern, leading counsel to believe no submissions on IFA were required; Board later decided against applicant based on IFA without allowing response
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review, annulment of decision, remittal for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Board failed to notify counsel that IFA would be a deciding factor
Assessment_Factor: Opportunity to make submissions on material issues
Applicable_Legislation: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide notice and opportunity to address IFA
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Allegation of procedural unfairness in refugee protection decision
Relief_Sought: Annulment of decision, remittal to differently constituted Board
Governing_Rule: Natural justice requires parties be given chance to address all material issues
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Counsel not given chance to present evidence or argument on IFA
Harm_Assessment: Prejudice due to inability to respond to decisive issue (IFA)
Cause_Description: Board's misleading communication prevented counsel from addressing IFA
Evidence_Handling: Failure to allow submission on key issue
Legal_Provision_Violated: Principles of natural justice under statutory framework
Evidence_Issues: Lack of opportunity to address evidentiary basis for IFA
Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Decision_Rationale: Decision based on issue not addressed by counsel due to Board's conduct
Evidentiary_Issues: Material issue (IFA) decided without adversarial input
